title: Deadline week update! Rankings for the top 50 MLB trade candidates
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some new names in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Bubble teams could shape week ahead
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: Ichiro shows funny side, joins CC, Wagner in HOF
content: Ichiro Suzuki's sense of humor was on full display Sunday, when he joined CC Sabathia, Billy Wagner, Dave Parker and Dick Allen in baseball's Hall of Fame.

title: Sources: Royals keeping Lugo on 2 years, $46M
content: Seth Lugo, who had been regarded as one of the best potential trade candidates this deadline season, will remain with the Royals on a two-year, $46 million extension, sources told ESPN.

title: Wallace takes Brickyard; 1st Black winner at Indy
content: Bubba Wallace became the first Black driver to win a major race on Indianapolis Motor Speedway's 2.5-mile oval, surviving a late rain delay, two overtimes, concerns over running out of fuel and a hard-charging Kyle Larson on Sunday in the Brickyard 400.

title: Reports: Liberty's Stewart avoids major leg injury
content: Liberty star Breanna Stewart underwent an MRI that revealed she avoided a significant injury to her right leg, according to reports.

title: Qawi, ex-convict who became champ, dies at 72
content: Dwight Muhammad Qawi, who became a Hall of Fame boxer during a 20-year career following an armed robbery conviction earlier in his life, died at age 72.

title: Jones listens as fans chant 'Pay Micah!' at camp
content: On Saturday, fans chanted "Pay Micah!" in support of star Micah Parsons getting an extension from the Cowboys.

title: 49ers DE Jackson taken off field via ambulance
content: 49ers DE Tarron Jackson was talking and moving his extremities after sustaining an injury during Sunday's practice.

title: Proper English: Lionesses beat Spain, win Euro
content: England beat Spain 3-1 in a penlty shootout to win Euro 2025 on Sunday, successfully defending the title they won in 2022 after an enthralling encounter.

title: England's Euro 2025 win defies logic; Spain's curse continues
content: England were ahead in the Euro 2025 knockouts for just four minutes and 52 seconds. But they beat Spain on penalties to defend their crown.

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: Ibrahimovic, Messi, Gerrard: The 10 best and 10 worst DPs in MLS history
content: With the MLS transfer window opening Thursday, ESPN looks back at some of the best and worst big-money signings in league history.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: Woad, 21, wins Scottish Open in debut as pro
content: Two weeks ago, Lottie Woad was the world's No. 1 amateur. On Sunday, the 21-year-old Englishwoman became an LPGA Tour champion in her professional debut.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Nusa, Fofana if Rodrygo move fails
content: Liverpool are prioritizing a move for Real Madrid winger Rodrygo but have other options. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: 'Maunvrat, maunvrat': How Tharoor deflected a question on Op Sindoor; watch video
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor remained silent on 'Operation Sindoor' ahead of a crucial Lok Sabha debate, fueling speculation about his party's stance. Tasked by the Centre to represent India's counterterrorism efforts post-Pahalgam attack, Tharoor's support for the operation, which targeted terror camps in Pakistan, has caused internal friction within the Congress.

title: 'In this dressing room ... ': Ex-cricketer says Gambhir should take chill pill
content: Sanjay Manjrekar suggests Gautam Gambhir needs to relax and be more open to criticism, particularly regarding Shubman Gill's captaincy and team selections. Manjrekar credits the players' resilience for India's draw against England, questioning Gambhir's tactical decisions and dismissing his defense of Gill's form. He also challenged Gambhir's explanation of Karun Nair's exclusion from the team.

title: Tesla signs chip deal with Samsung, Musk says: Samsung agreed to allow ...
content: Tesla, led by Elon Musk, has secured a significant $16.5 billion chip supply agreement with Samsung Electronics through 2033. Samsung will customize Tesla-designed chips, with its Texas plant dedicated to producing Tesla's next-generation A16 chipset. Musk will personally oversee manufacturing efficiency.

title: UP shocker: Patients treated in torchlight at Ballia hospital
content: A power outage and generator failure plunged Ballia district hospital's emergency room into darkness, forcing medical staff to treat patients under torchlight. The 45-minute blackout occurred on Friday evening, prompting a swift response from health officials. Additional inverters have been installed to prevent future incidents and improve the system's efficiency.

title: ‘Don’t resign under pressure….’: TCS layoffs opposed by IT employee unions
content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) faces objections from IT employee organizations over its plan to reduce staff by approximately 12,000, impacting middle and senior positions. Unions deem the dismissals unlawful, advising employees to resist resignation pressures.

title: 'What’s with the English?' — Karthik, Vaughan weigh in on handshake drama
content: The drawn fourth Test between India and England witnessed heated debate after Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar refused an early draw offer, frustrating England captain Ben Stokes. Dinesh Karthik questioned England's sportsmanship, while Michael Vaughan supported India's decision to allow their batsmen to pursue centuries. With the series at 2-1, the controversy adds fuel to the highly anticipated Oval Test.

title: OpenAI CEO admits he is ‘scared’ to use AI: ‘I don’t know who is…’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman expressed concerns about the rapid advancement of AI, admitting his own apprehension about using certain AI tools due to data privacy concerns. He acknowledged the intense competition among AI companies and the potential for AI to reshape society, while also addressing fears about job displacement and the need for adaptation in a future dominated by AI.

title: 8 years 4 months and 10 days: Yogi Adityanath becomes CM with longest consecutive tenure in UP
content: Yogi Adityanath has become Uttar Pradesh's longest-serving Chief Minister, exceeding Govind Ballabh Pant's record. Adityanath, a BJP leader, has been in office for 8 years, 4 months, and 10 days. He initially assumed the role in 2017 after a significant BJP victory, replacing Akhilesh Yadav.

title: 'Joota se maarenge': RJD MLA Bhai Virendra 'threatens' panchayat secretary
content: RJD MLA Bhai Virendra is embroiled in controversy following a leaked audio clip where he allegedly threatens a panchayat secretary. The Maner representative reportedly berated the official for not recognizing his voice and demanded a death certificate. The conversation escalated, with the MLA allegedly threatening violence and further repercussions, sparking outrage and widespread attention on social media platforms.

title: Cash haul row: SC questions Justice Varma over his petition against impeachment
content: The Supreme Court questioned Justice Yashwant Varma's plea challenging an inquiry report that recommended his impeachment over burnt cash found at his residence. The court raised concerns about his participation in the inquiry and the parties named in the petition.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 bn worth of Amazon shares, now holds stock valued at…
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: 'Ben Stokes behaved like a spoiled kid': Ex-India batter slams England captain
content: Sanjay Manjrekar lauded India's resilience in the Manchester Test draw, criticising Ben Stokes' conduct as unsportsmanlike. He highlighted India's batting depth, particularly Washington Sundar's emergence as a valuable all-rounder.

title: Did Trump cheat at a golf game? Caddie's video goes viral
content: A video has surfaced from President Trump's golf trip to Scotland, igniting accusations of cheating. The footage shows a caddie seemingly dropping a ball in the rough during Trump's visit to his Turnberry resort. This incident has revived long-standing claims of Trump's alleged history of bending the rules on the golf course, sparking divided reactions online.

title: India treads cautiously after Trump’s trade agreements with Japan
content: India-US trade deal: India is cautiously approaching trade negotiations with the US, observing complications in recent American deals with Japan, Indonesia, and Vietnam. Discrepancies exist between US and Japanese officials regarding investment profit allocation.

title: Bought for Rs 90,000, sold as IVF baby for Rs 35 lakh; how clinic gave away newborns
content: Hyderabad police uncovered a surrogacy scam at Universal Srushti Fertility Centre, arresting eight individuals, including Dr. Athaluri Namratha, for allegedly selling infants to couples under the guise of IVF. The clinic, operating without a valid license since 2021, deceived a couple who paid Rs 35 lakh, providing them with a baby unrelated to them.

title: 'Dog Babu' gets Patna residence certificate; Yogendra says 'acceptable in Bihar’s SIR'
content: Yogendra Yadav criticized the Bihar government after a residence certificate was issued to a dog named 'Dog Babu' in Patna. Yadav highlighted the absurdity, noting that this certificate is being accepted under SIR while genuine Aadhaar and ration cards are being questioned.

title: IND vs ENG | Viral Video: Fan asked to cover Pakistan jersey at Old Trafford
content: A video went viral showing a fan in a Pakistan cricket jersey being asked by security at the England-India Test match at Old Trafford to cover it up. Stadium staff cited venue regulations that only apparel supporting participating teams was allowed.

title: Turkey earthquake: Did Google fail to alert millions?
content: Google acknowledged its Android Earthquake Alerts system's failure to issue critical warnings before the devastating 2023 Turkey earthquake, which resulted in over 55,000 deaths. The system underestimated the quake's magnitude, leading to insufficient "Take Action" alerts. This revelation has sparked concerns about over-reliance on Google's alerts and the need for transparent performance assessments.

title: R Ashwin rips into Ben Stokes: 'Your frustration, not our problem!'
content: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's decision. They chose to bat on and complete their centuries. This happened after England captain Ben Stokes offered a draw. Ashwin criticized Stokes's offer. He believed India earned the runs. He said centuries should not be gifted. The incident occurred during the fourth Test in Manchester. India and England eventually shook hands.

title: Heartbroken man jumps off 35-ft bridge after wife leaves, survives
content: In Gwalior, a 28-year-old man, Mukesh Ahirwar, distraught after his wife left following a quarrel, attempted suicide by jumping from a railway overbridge. He survived the 35-foot fall with minor injuries, thanks to the absence of train movement. After receiving treatment and counseling, he was discharged and handed over to his family for support.

title: TCS to cut 12,000 jobs: What future tech pros need to thrive
content: Tata Consultancy Services plans to reduce its workforce by approximately 12,000 employees, representing 2% of its global staff, as part of a strategic shift towards automation and AI readiness. This decision, impacting middle and senior management, reflects broader industry trends driven by economic pressures and the need for enhanced productivity.

title: Hall of Fame boxer ‘Camden Buzzsaw’ Dwight Muhammad Qawi dies at age 72
content: Dwight Muhammad Qawi, the former two-division world champion and International Boxing Hall of Famer, has passed away at 72 after a five-year battle with dementia. Known as "The Camden Buzzsaw," Qawi's life was a story of redemption, transforming from a prison inmate convicted of armed robbery to a boxing icon.

title: AC coach or general compartment? Overcrowded train in Katihar leaves passengers fuming
content: A viral video shows unreserved passengers flooding an AC coach on the Sikkim Mahananda Express at Katihar station, sparking outrage and questions about railway management. The incident, captured in a video, highlights concerns about overcrowding and passenger safety in reserved compartments. Indian Railways has responded by requesting details and escalating the issue to the Katihar division.

title: Fact check: Did Stokes refuse to shake hands with Jadeja? Watch video
content: The drawn fourth Test at Old Trafford was filled with drama, including Ben Stokes' appeal for an early draw and visible tension. Despite claims circulating online, video evidence confirms that England captain Ben Stokes did shake hands with Ravindra Jadeja after the match. The series remains 2-1 in England's favor, setting the stage for a high-stakes final Test at The Oval.

title: Gold price prediction: What's gold rate outlook for July 28 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to trade sideways due to diminished safe-haven demand as the US secures trade deals. Profit booking and easing global trade tensions have also contributed to the downward pressure.

title: 'Misogynistic ': 'Cleric' booked for slurs against Dimple Yadav
content: Lucknow police have filed a First Information Report (FIR) against Maulana Sajid Rashidi following a complaint by Pravesh Yadav. The complaint alleges that Rashidi made offensive and misogynistic comments against Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav on television and public platforms.

title: SC takes up SIR: 35L voters missing; Oppn mounts pressure – explained in 10 points
content: A dispute surrounds the Election Commission's revision of voter lists in Bihar. Opposition parties allege voter suppression. They have taken the matter to the Supreme Court. The court is hearing the case. The Election Commission defends the revision as necessary for fair elections. Concerns arise about voter verification and potential disenfranchisement. The revision may extend nationwide.

title: 'Just fight ...': Washington reveals Gambhir's stirring final-day message
content: All-rounder Washington Sundar's maiden Test century spurred India to a draw against England at Old Trafford. Following Gautam Gambhir's message to 'fight for the entire day,' Sundar's unbeaten 101, coupled with Ravindra Jadeja's century, forged a 203-run partnership. India, initially struggling, recovered to 425/4, keeping the series alive at 2-1.

title: ‘Never had failed intelligence system’: Cong uses Chola reference to attack PM
content: Congress MP Manickam Tagore criticized Prime Minister Modi's Chola tribute, alleging intelligence failures and comparing Modi's foreign policy unfavorably to the Chola empire's. Tagore accused Modi of succumbing to foreign pressure and challenged him to address these issues in Parliament. Modi, celebrating Rajendra Chola I's legacy, highlighted the Chola era's cultural and strategic achievements, emphasizing the repatriation of looted artifacts.

title: Handshake denied! Washington Sundar cold-shoulders Harry Brook, video goes viral - WATCH
content: India showcased resilience, securing a draw against England in the fourth Test after batting for 143 overs. Ravindra Jadeja's century and Washington Sundar's maiden ton rescued India from a significant first-innings deficit. Despite England's imposing 669, India's fightback, highlighted by Gill's century and Rahul's 90, ensured a draw.

title: Twin meteor showers to light up July 29–30 skies with 25 shooting stars an hour
content: Get ready for a celestial treat. Two meteor showers, Southern Delta Aquariids and Alpha Capricornids, will peak together. The event is expected on July 29–30, 2025. Skywatchers can see up to 25 meteors per hour. The Southern Hemisphere will have the best view. A moonless sky will ensure great visibility. Do not miss this natural light show.

title: 'Messi! Messi!' — Fans erupt as Lionel Messi attends Coldplay concert with wife | WATCH
content: Lionel Messi, suspended from a recent Inter Miami game, created a buzz at Coldplay's Miami concert. The crowd erupted in "Messi!" chants upon seeing him on the video board, briefly turning the concert into a football celebration. This moment highlighted Messi's global popularity, blending his sporting fame into American pop culture.

title: Chidambaram on Pahalgam attack: 'Why assume terrorists came from Pak?'
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram has criticized the government's handling of the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, citing a lack of transparency. He questioned the government's silence on key details, including the attackers' identity and the NIA's investigation progress. Chidambaram speculated the government might be concealing tactical errors and losses.

title: Police constable’s wife dies by suicide in UP, alleges harassment by in-laws
content: Saumya Kashyap, the wife of a Uttar Pradesh police constable, tragically died by suicide, leaving behind an Instagram video accusing her in-laws of severe harassment. She alleged they pressured her husband to remarry and that her brother-in-law threatened her life. Authorities were alerted after the video surfaced, and an investigation is underway following the notification of Saumya's family.

title: IND vs ENG | The final-hour handshake drama at Old Trafford
content: Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, and Shubman Gill's centuries powered India to a morale-boosting draw in the fourth Test against England. Despite a handshake offer from Ben Stokes, Jadeja and Sundar continued batting, facing some verbal exchanges, ultimately reaching their respective centuries. The match concluded with handshakes and reflections on valuable learnings.

title: ISI-backed arms, drug racket busted: Consignment linked to Bhagwanpuria aide; 5 held
content: Punjab Police, working with central agencies, dismantled an ISI-backed trans-border smuggling ring, arresting five operatives. The operation seized assault rifles, pistols, ammunition, drug money, and a vehicle. Investigations revealed direct links between the arrested individuals and Pakistani ISI handlers, with the consignment intended for a close associate of gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria, highlighting a terror-gangster connection.

title: Heart attack risk? This heart scan can tell you more than a cholesterol test
content: Discover a quick CT scan that reveals heart attack risk by detecting calcium buildup in arteries, offering a more accurate assessment than cholesterol tests alone. Ideal for those aged 40-80 with intermediate risk or uncertain about statin therapy, this test provides a clear calcium score, guiding preventative treatment and potentially saving lives through early intervention.

title: WTC Standings: England lose ground, India edge up despite draw; Aus stay top
content: India's remarkable draw at Old Trafford against England not only kept the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy hopes alive but also slightly bolstered their position in the World Test Championship (WTC) 2025-27 standings. Centuries from Shubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja, and Washington Sundar helped India salvage a draw after conceding a massive first-innings lead.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 24,800; BSE Sensex down over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was down below 24,800, BSE Sensex dipped over 200 points.

title: Two devotees electrocuted outside Awshaneshwar temple in Barabanki
content: In Barabanki district, a tragic incident occurred outside the Awshaneshwar Mahadev temple, resulting in the electrocution of two devotees and injuries to several others. The incident happened when they came into contact with an electrified iron pipe and tin shed erected for monsoon shelter. Authorities are investigating the cause, suspecting faulty wiring or leakage.

title: Cash-at-home controversy: Judge Varma hides identity, is ‘XXX’ in his SC petition - details
content: Justice Yashwant Varma, facing a Parliament removal motion over cash found at his residence, has anonymously petitioned the Supreme Court to quash the inquiry report and the former CJI's recommendation for his removal. The Supreme Court is set to hear his plea, alongside another petition seeking an FIR against him.

title: Vanessa Bryant reacts warmly to Ciara’s joyful family post with Russell Wilson
content: Vanessa Bryant showed her support for Russell Wilson's family by commenting on Ciara's Instagram post, which featured the family cheering Wilson at training camp. This gesture highlights the strong bond between Vanessa and Ciara, who have supported each other through various life events, including Kobe Bryant's passing. Their families share a close friendship, celebrating milestones and vacations together.

title: 'Aid must be permitted to reach people': Obama voices concern over Gaza
content: Barack Obama has called for immediate action to prevent starvation in Gaza, emphasizing the urgent need for aid access. While Israel announced a "tactical pause," Trump accused Hamas of diverting aid, a claim disputed by the Israeli military. Netanyahu defended Israel's aid efforts, accusing the UN of spreading falsehoods regarding humanitarian access.

title: Cauvery river in spate, water enters low-lying areas in Erode’s Bhavani
content: The river enters Erode district at Nerinjipettai and flows through Ammapettai, Bhavani, Erode city and Kodumudi. A NDRF team is stationed in Bhavani and a SDRF team is camping at Erode city.

title: Visit to Singapore aims to set record straight, rebuild investor confidence: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Chandrababu Naidu meets Singapore Minister Tan See Leng; pitches Andhra Pradesh as a hub for innovation, green energy, and logistics

title: Amaravati housing projects: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu seeks Singapore’s collaboration
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu observed that Singapore had already provided a master plan for the capital city and noted that the World Bank is also participating in the construction process

title: Madras High Court orders CBI probe into former BJP Yuva Morcha functionary’s murder in Puducherry
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs Senior Superintendent of Police, Puducherry, to hand over the case files to the CBI forthwith

title: Ensure people are not harassed during revision of electoral rolls: Bengal CM tells officials
content: Mamata Banerjee announced that a dedicated scheme will be launched to assist the alleged persecuted Bengali migrants who have returned from other states

title: Muslim cleric booked for ‘objectionable’ remarks on Samajwadi Party MP Dimple Yadav
content: The remarks in question were allegedly made in response to Dimple Yadav's recent visit to a mosque, where the cleric reportedly commented inappropriately on her attire.

title: Vijay Shah remark row: Supreme Court raps M.P. Minister over public apology
content: In one of the previous sittings, the court had remarked that the Minister’s comments amounted to “crass, thoughtless remarks”

title: Bihar SIR: Trinamool Congress MP Saket Gokhale slams electoral roll revision; claims 1.26 crore voters 'deleted'
content: Saket Gokhale said the poll panel "conveniently" did not share any information regarding its claim of having found foreign nationals in Bihar

title: Debate on Operation Sindoor: Opposition running away from discussion, says Kiren Rijiju
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said Parliament runs in accordance with rules and accused the Opposition of going back on its commitment and betraying everyone

title: Delhi High Court to hear pleas against Centre’s nod to release Udaipur Files film on July 30
content: The two petitions were listed before the High Court in pursuance to the Supreme Court’s direction to the petitioners to approach the high court against the Centre’s decision of giving nod for the film’s release

title: Supreme Court takes suo motu cognisance of report over dog bites leading to rabies
content: The Supreme Court Bench said every day, hundreds of dog bites were being reported in the city and on its outskirts, leading to rabies and ultimately, children and the aged were falling prey to the dreadful disease

title: Around 1,78,261 ha of compensatory afforestation raised; 85% of planned area achieved; gaps in fund use: CEC report
content: The report revealed that utilisation of funds under the Compensatory Afforestation Fund Management and Planning Authority varies sharply across States

title: Supreme Court stays Calcutta HC order on West Bengal OBC list
content: How can the High Court pass such an order? Reservation is part of the executive function, Supreme Court said

title: NCP(SP) MLA Rohit Pawar was in touch with BJP leaders: Minister Nitesh Rane
content: Nitesh Rane claimed that though Rohit Pawar is part of the Sharad Pawar-led NCP (Sharad Pawar), “his heart lies with the BJPs”

title: Supreme Court rejects Ilaiyaraaja’s plea for transfer of copyright case from Bombay HC to Madras HC
content: The counsel for Sony Music Entertainment told the Bench that the case by the firm was filed in the Bombay High Court when no case was pending in the Madras High Court

title: KUFOS Vice-Chancellor denies reports of sharing dais with RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: A. Bijukumar, in a statement, says he had attended an education seminar organised by Association of Indian Universities at Amrita Vidyapeetam

title: Sonia, Kharge, Rahul, Akhilesh join Opposition leaders in protest against SIR
content: There was a huge banner in front of them which read 'SIR- Attack on Democracy' as they lined up and staged a protest for the fifth consecutive day

title: Presidential Reference ‘misleading’, wants SC to sit on appeal against its own verdict in T.N. Governor case, says Kerala to Supreme Court
content: Kerala State pointed out that the Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment authored by Justice J.B. Pardiwala on April 8 has already addressed in detail the questions raised in the Presidential Reference in May

title: Supreme Court quashes FIR against shuttler Lakshya Sen in birth certificate forgery case
content: The case stems from a private complaint filed by M.G. Nagaraj who alleged that birth certificates of Lakshya Sen and his brother Chirag Sen were forged

title: Earth observation NISAR satellite will be launched on July 30, says ISRO chairman
content: NISAR-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar will observe earth with a swath of 242 km and high spatial resolution, using SweepSAR technology for the first time, according to the space agency

title: Siddappa Kambali Law College signs MoU with Mangaluru firm to provide exposure to students
content: Karnatak University Sir Siddappa Kambali Law College (KUSSK), Dharwad signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with SCLRSEA, VDMS Private Limited, Mangaluru

title: ‘Interpretations being presented as facts by a section of media’
content: Senior journalist says that ‘in the new models of media that are emerging, manufacturing consent seems to be a priority. This change has happened after journalism became an industry’

title: Karnataka MP says new amendment to Income Tax Act will impact services of Chartered Accountants
content: Member of Parliament G. Kumar Naik offers to raise the issue in the Lok Sabha if Chartered Accountants provide a detailed report on how the new amendment would impact their work

title: Bihar SIR row hearing LIVE: Bench to meet again to finalise  schedule of hearing
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi hearing the matter, reiterated the ECI to consider Aadhaar and EPIC as proof for voter registration

title: SC hearing on Justice Varma’s petition LIVE: SC asks Sibal to place on record the fact-finding committee report, adjourns case to July 30
content: CJI B.R. Gavai’s willingness to judicially examine the question of Justice Varma’s removal comes days after the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members initiated a removal motion and submitted notices on the same

title: Three patients die at Jalandhar civil hospital, families blame fault in oxygen supply
content: While the hospital said there was a dip in oxygen pressure because of a technical fault, it was rectified within no time

title: Five militants involved in extortion activity arrested in Manipur
content: Three active cadres of the banned Kangleipak Communist Party (Apunba City Meitei) were arrested from Imphal East district on July 27, 2025

title: 26th batch of 1,635 pilgrims leave Jammu for Amarnath Yatra
content: The 38-day pilgrimage to the 3,880-metre-high shrine, which commenced on July 3 from the valley, has recorded darshan of the ice lingam of Lord Shiva by more than 3.77 lakh pilgrims

title: Supreme Court To Hear Case Against Minister Over Remarks On Colonel Today
content: The Supreme Court will hear on Monday the case involving Madhya Pradesh Tribal Affairs Minister Vijay Shah's controversial remarks against Colonel Sofia Qureshi.

title: Shashi Tharoor Not On Op Sindoor Debate List, Congress Sources Say He Declined
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor evaded a question on whether he would speak during the special discussion in the Parliament on Operation Sindoor today, amid reports that he is not among the speakers chosen by his Congress party.

title: "Very Disturbing, Alarming": Supreme Court On Rising Stray Dog Bite Cases
content: The Supreme Court took suo motu cognisance of a media report about incidents of dog bites leading to rabies.

title: 16-Year-Old Girl Kidnapped, Raped In A Moving Car In Punjab, FIR Registered
content: According to Station House Officer (SHO) Satinder Singh, the 16-year-old girl was standing near the metro when two men kidnapped her. She was forced into a black car, where the two men allegedly raped her.

title: How Former Prisoners In Russia Are Rebuilding Lives in Ukraine
content: Since his release from a Russian prison in April, Stanislav Tarnavskyi has been in a hurry to build the life in Ukraine he dreamed about during three years of captivity.

title: Google Admits Alert System Failure During Turkey's 2023 Earthquake
content: Google's Android Earthquake Alerts System (AEA) failed to accurately warn people ahead of the 2023 Turkey twin quakes, which killed more than 55,000 people and injured over 1 lakh, the tech giant has admitted.

title: "Lanka Burned, So Did Pakistan's Terror Camps": Kiren Rijiju's Message  Ahead Of Op Sindoor Debate In Lok Sabha
content: When Pakistan crossed the red lines drawn by India, terror camps faced the fire, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju said on Monday as the Lok Sabha took up the discussion on Operation Sindoor.

title: Cluster Of Potentially Deadly Pneumonia-Like Cases Found In New York
content: The New York City Department of Health reported that since around July 25, five people have been diagnosed with the severe, pneumonia-like illness in the Manhattan neighbourhood.

title: Odisha Floods: 600 People Affected In Jajpur District, Yellow Warning Issued
content: The rising water of the Baitarani River, due to incessant rainfall, triggered severe flooding in Jajpur district of Odisha, affecting nearly 600 people and 150 households in four villages.

title: Dementia Takes 3.5 Years To Diagnose After Symptoms Begin: Study
content: People with dementia are diagnosed an average of 3.5 years after symptoms are first noticed, according to a new study.

title: Tata Consultancy Services' Shares Drop After Layoff Announcement
content: Shares of tech major Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) were trading lower on Monday, following the company's announcement to lay off around 12,200 employees in FY26.

title: Man Arrested For Stealing Gold Biscuits In Delhi Metro, Rs 3 Lakh Recovered
content: On July 11, a case of gold theft was registered on the complaint of Amit Santra, who reported the theft of gold biscuits weighing 141.670gm from his side bag while travelling in a running Metro Train between Bahadurgarh to Shadipur Metro Station.

title: Syria To Hold Parliamentary Elections In September, 1st Since Bashar Al-Assad's Regime Fall
content: Syria will hold parliamentary elections in September, the head of a body tasked with organising the election process told state media Sunday.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 6 Live Updates: Lok Sabha Adjourned Till 1 PM
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will open the debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha. Home Minister Amit Shah, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and Prime Minister Narendra Modi are likely to intervene.

title: 'Work 10 Hours A Day, Exhausted Like A Dog': Chinese Delivery Man Breaks Down In Viral Video
content: A Chinese delivery executive burst into tears in the middle of his shift and recorded a video to detail his struggle and one regret: dropping out of school at an early age.

title: BJP vs P Chidambaram Before Parliament's Big Debate On Operation Sindoor
content: Countering the BJP's attack over his remarks on the Pahalgam terror attack, Congress veteran P Chidambaram has said the "worst kind of troll" is one who suppresses a full interview and uses two sentences to paint the speaker black.

title: "Anti-Women": Cleric Faces Case For Remark On Samajwadi MP Dimple Yadav
content: Dimple Yadav attended a meeting with her politician husband, Akhilesh Yadav, and other senior leaders of her party at a mosque in Delhi.

title: "Clean Chit To Pak": BJP Slams P Chidambaram's "Homegrown Terrorists" Remark
content: Ahead of the Operation Sindoor debate in Parliament, a massive political row has erupted over Congress veteran P Chidambaram's remarks in an interview, in which he said "homegrown terrorists" could be involved in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: IIM Calcutta To Allow Student Out On Bail In Rape Case To Attend Classes
content: Indian Institute of Management Calcutta (IIMC) authorities have decided to allow its student who was arrested on rape charge and is now out on bail to attend classes, an official said.

title: Himachal Pradesh suffers losses of ₹1500 crore during ongoing monsoon season
content: So far, 88 people have died and 35 have gone missing in rain-related incidents, and 1,316 houses have been fully or partially damaged in the state

title: When all are treated equally, conflicts end, peace prevails, says Dingaleshwar Swami
content: The seer said that had it not been for Sufi saints and reformers like Basavanna and other sharanas, rivers of blood would have flown in the country

title: In Gujarat’s Amreli, a bedroom behind bars
content: A widowed farmer has formed a “human cage” to defend  the prowling leopards that stalk his rented farm, turning their lives into a nightly battle for survival

title: Police officers’ association condemns YSRCP leaders’ remarks
content: Former Minister Ambati Rambabu’s statement that a rowdy sheet will be opened against an IPS officer is unacceptable in a democratic set-up, the association says

title: Activists demand Devadasi survey without condition of age limit
content: The centuries-old practice of dedication of women to temples as Devadasis has been banned in the State since 1982 when the Karnataka Devadasis (Prohibition of Dedication) Act was enacted

title: Govt. offers special package of incentives to Kadapa steel plant
content: The JSW Steel Limited intends to begin construction of first phase of the plant in January 2026 and begin commercial production by April 2029

title: CBI arrests three in cybercrime case
content: During the investigation, the CBI unearthed the entire conspiracy of opening the mule account by the bankers without “proper KYC norms” or “Customer Due Diligence” or “Initial Risk Assessment”

title: Gujarat approves action plan for Artificial Intelligence implementation in governance
content: Implementation will be carried out in phases, starting with the creation of a State-level AI data repository, setting up AI development facilities, and launching pilot projects in selected departments

title: ‘Mughal period saw violence; Britain did not recognise suffering inflicted on colonies’: Michel Danino
content: Michel Danino, IIT Gandhinagar Guest Professor and head of NCERT’s Social Science textbook team, on historical framing in the new class seven and eight textbooks, media criticism, and debates over representation

title: ZSI scientists discover a wolf spider, and four wasp species from West Bengal
content: Piratula acuminata marks the first record of the genus Piratula in India; in a separate study, ZSI researchers identified and described four new species of parasitoid wasps belonging to the genus Idris

title: BRS urges Telangana HC to step in over recurring food poisoning incidents in residential schools
content: Party leaders led by T. Harish Rao visit Uyyalawada where 111 students had taken ill due to suspected food poisoning

title: DRDO pushes for hypersonic edge against evolving air threats
content: Top defence scientists deliberated on the performance of the indigenous hi-tech missile systems such as Akash air-defence, Brahmos, MRSAM, ULPGM, all of which were developed at the missile complex in Hyderabad

title: Muslim hawker assaulted in Meerut; attempt to create fear, says opposition
content: While locals claim the victim was mistaken for a thief, his wife alleged they are being forced to modify the complaint

title: TGSWREIS records 5-year high Inter admission rate at 86.7%
content: Of 19,680 available seats, 17,100 have already been filled; emaining institution-wise vacancies will be filled through spot counselling scheduled for July 31

title: Jammu ‘shoot-out’: J&K Police take suspended policemen to crime site, seize service rifle, victim’s bike
content: Officials said the SIT, headed by a Deputy Superintendent of Police-rank officer, visited the site in Satwari where the incident took place on July 24

title: Mamata launches ‘language movement’, condemns targeting of migrant’s family in Delhi
content: Migrants from West Bengal have been detained in different states like Odisha, Haryana and Delhi on suspicion of being Bangladeshi nationals.

title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi soaks in spiritual experience on his visit to Gangaikonda Cholapuram
content: He offers prayers at the Brihadisvara temple, built by Rajendra Chola I, which is famous for its imposing architecture and exquisite sculptures

title: Clearing the air on ‘citizenship’ in Bihar poll roll revision
content: The political objections being raised on the issue of citizenship reveal a lack of knowledge of the Constitution, legislation and the working of the electoral system

title: ‘Su From So’: How an unheralded Kannada film broke marketing norms to set box office records
content: The Raj B Shetty-produced ‘Su From So’, a surprise hit of 2025, breaks box office records with minimal promotion, emphasising quality content over excessive marketing

title: Bihar SIR: 91.69% have submitted enumeration forms, says Election Commission of India
content: Of the 7.89 crore registered electors as on June 24, over 7.24 crore had submitted enumeration forms indicating overwhelming participation, the poll body says

title: Senior Living Conclave 2025 held in Chennai
content: The conclave emphaised the importance of design and healthcare features such as anti-skid flooring, emergency response systems and access to on-call doctors in making homes safer for seniors

title: Detainees being released, but crackdown on ‘illegal immigrants’ continues in Gurugram, say police
content: The drive has drawn widespread criticism over the alleged harassment of detainees and targeting of Bengali-speaking migrant workers from Assam and West Bengal

title: RESA extension work at Calicut airport in progress
content: Though the project is scheduled to be completed by March next year, the construction company has sought an extension of three months because of the delay caused by the rain

title: New Zealand kayakers steal the show at 11th edition of Malabar River Festival finale
content: Among the Indian kayakers, Arjun Singh Rawat secured the top position, followed by Amar Singh Ankit and Kuldeep Singh in second and third place, respectively

title: Not just mass burial, Special Investigation Team must probe murders of Padmalatha, Soujanya, Vedavalli, and Yamuna in Dharmasthala: Women
content: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) was constituted by the government of Karnataka to investigate the Dharmasthala burial cases

title: Surbana Jurong and Eversendai show interest to invest in Andhra Pradesh
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu invites Surbana Jurong to play a pivotal role in the State’s ‘Housing for All’ initiative; Eversendai Engineering proposes establishment of a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility and an integrated training center

title: Digital recreation of Portuguese Fort at Chaliyam in final stages
content: The fort was built at the mouth of Beypore river around 1530, reportedly with the support of local chieftains opposed to Calicut kingdom. It was constructed at a strategic location to corner Zamorin

title: Cong., IUML express concern over draft voters’ list
content: Kozhikode DCC to approach HC over alleged discrepancies in the draft voters’ list for local body polls; names of a large number of voters missing in list, says Local Government Members’ League

title: Mallikarjun Kharge recalls how he missed a chance to becoming Chief Minister
content: The AICC president becomes emotional while participating in a function organised in memory of the founders of BLDE Society in Vijayapura

title: Dams continue to release water, flood alert for Bhavani basin
content: Several houses in Chittur taluk were flooded following accumulation of trees at Thiruvazhiyode bridge. Road traffic was affected following uprooting of trees at different parts. District officials said that two dozen houses were damaged in the rain since Saturday

title: CAPF personnel injured during operations will get full benefits till retirement: Union Home Secretary
content: Govind Mohan said the government will ensure the best medical facilities and technology available in the world for ‘limb replacement surgery’ for CAPF officials and jawans and it will be ensured that loss of limbs is corrected as far as possible

title: 'Not found suitable' clause weaponised against SCs, STs, OBCs to deny them job opportunities: Congress
content: Rahul Gandhi also attacked the Modi government over vacant reserved posts for SCs, STs, and OBCs in central universities and said this is not just negligence but a "well-planned conspiracy" to keep "bahujans" out of education, research and policies.

title: NCB, police in Rajasthan and Maharashtra bust inter-State synthetic drug syndicate
content: Clandestine labs uncovered in Barmer and Raigad; precursors and equipment seized, investigation underway

title: Stop SIR in Bihar, refrain from ‘institutional arrogance’, says INDIA bloc
content: Stating that the SIR had become a process of establishing citizenship, Congress leader Abhishek Manu Singhvi asked if the Election Commission was authorised to do so

title: Six BJP workers injured in alleged TIPRA Motha attack in Tripura
content: Clashes occurred during PM’s Mann Ki Baat broadcast in Khowai district; Forest Minister denies party role

title: Critical vulnerability exposed sensitive data of voluntary organ donors
content: After security researcher’s alert, Computer Emergency Response Team plugged the gap in AIIMS portal; in an email to CERT, the researcher had flagged that the vulnerability disclosed personally identifiable and medical information of donors

title: The return of the native
content: After over a decade of wandering and uncertainty, the Kodarvi tribe returned to their village this July following a truce with the Dabhi tribe that had pushed them out of their lands in a tradition called chadotaru. Abhinay Deshpande reports from Gujarat’s Banaskantha district on how the police played a role in the agreement between communities and the rebuilding of their lives

title: 🏇 Jokic emotional after horse wins race in Serbia
content: Nikola Jokic's horse won a race in Subotica, Serbia . he sprayed and dumped champagne on the group before poured champagne on himself . his horse races take place on Sundays, and the parade would cut it close .

title: OBJ reaches out to 14U flag football champion who went viral
content: a one-handed catch by Brysen Wright landed his game-worn jersey in the Pro Football Hall of Fame . Wright said he thought Wright's catch was better, but there's no deception . he said if he needed anything he was there for me, he would help me .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Giants QB Dart has strong practice
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams .

title: Stakes too high at Spa to risk safety on wet-weather drama
content: the Belgium GP has been suspended after just one formation lap behind the safety car . rain fell over one of motor racing's most revered circuits midway through Sunday afternoon . the anthem was sung in heavy rain, although it seemed to be easing off by the time the scheduled 3 p.m. local start time approached .
